intro: Justicia xantholeuca, commonly known as the yellow flame plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and can grow up to 3 meters in height. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
